TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProsodyVolume extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates values for the property of a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically synthetic speech engine output volume as defined by the members of ProsodyVolume correspond to a percent of the maximum possible output loudness. For instance Loud corresponds to approximately 80% of the maximum volume. However, any specific synthetic speech engine implementations may choose how to render audio output for a given value of ProsodyVolume.
The current base volume setting for a custom synthetic speech engine is obtained as a ProsodyVolume value through the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite.Volume%2A> property on the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite> site supplied to that engine. ProsodyVolume.
Fine tuning and modulation of output volume is managed on the basis of particular <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> objects, using members of ProsodyVolume to set the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody.Volume%2A> property on instances of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody> used in creating or modifying the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> object for the instance of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume Default = int32(-1)

Docs.summary: Current default volume value, same as the value returned by the P:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite.Volume?qualifyHint=False

.field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume Loud = int32(-6)

.field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume Silent = int32(-2)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume Soft = int32(-4)
